Description: WITH THEIR EXTENSIVE EXPERIENCE GATHERING, MANAGING, AND PRESENTING FISHERIES DATA, PACIFIC STATES MARINE FISHERIES COMMISSION WILL SUPPORT THE NEEDS OF ELECTRONIC MONITORING THROUGH 1) RESEARCH AND TESTING OF ELECTRONIC DATA CAPTURE TECHNOLOGIES; 2) DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF DATA CAPTURE TECHNOLOGIES; AND 3) INTEGRATION OF ELECTRONIC DATA COLLECTION TECHNOLOGIES INTO EXISTING OBSERVER AND ELECTRONIC MONITORING PROGRAMS.

THIS PROJECT PROVIDES TECHNICAL AND FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO COLLECT AND PROCESS FISHERIES MONITORING DATA USED LOCAL AND FEDERAL FISHERIES MANAGEMENT PROGRAMS. THE DATA OBTAINED THROUGH THIS PROJECT IS THE PRINCIPAL SOURCE OF INFORMATION AND ANALYSIS OF FISHERIES ACTIVITIES AND MANAGEMENT OPTIONS FOR THE COMMONWEALTH OF THE NORTHERN MARIANA ISLANDS (CNMI). DATA MAY ALSO BE USED TO ADDRESS FEDERAL REQUIREMENTS FOR FISHERIES MANAGEMENT PLANS. BY PARTICIPATING IN THE WESTERN PACIFIC FISHERIES INFORMATION NETWORK PROGRAM THROUGH SUPPORT PROVIDED BY THIS PROJECT, DATA AND INFORMATION REQUIRED BY THE WESTERN PACIFIC REGIONAL FISHERY MANAGEMENT COUNCIL CAN BE PROVIDED. AUGMENTING AND IMPROVING LOCAL FISHERIES MONITORING PROGRAMS THROUGH THIS PROPOSAL MAXIMIZES EFFICIENCY OF THE PROGRAMS AND ELIMINATES DUPLICATION OF EFFORT BY UTILIZING LOCAL AGENCY INFRASTRUCTURE AND PERSONNEL TO MEET SHARED COMMONWEALTH AND FEDERAL MONITORING AND MANAGEMENT NEEDS.

THE ALASKA DEPARTMENT OF FISH AND GAME'S PROJECT FOR INDIVIDUAL FISHING QUOTA WILL ASSIST WITH SUPPORTING THE INTERNAL ELANDINGS PROGRAM MANAGEMENT, TRAINING AND SUPPORT, AND INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY FUNCTIONS PERTAINING TO THE INDIVIDUAL FISHING QUOTA HALIBUT AND SABLEFISH FISHERIES. THE DEPARTMENT PERSONNEL SUPPORT HIGHLY COMPLEX SYSTEMS, END USER SUPPORT, INTER-AGENCY PERSONNEL TRAINING, AND PROGRAM OUTREACH. THIS INCLUDES TIMELY PROCESSING OF HALIBUT AND SABLEFISH LANDING REPORTS/FISH TICKETS, ANALYSIS TOOLS TO ASSIST INTERAGENCY MONITORING OF THIS FISHERY, AND COORDINATION OF INTERAGENCY PRIORITIES.

THE ALASKA DEPARTMENT OF FISH AND GAME IS SEEKING SUPPORT FOR FIELD RESEARCH OF BERING SEA RED KING CRAB FOR A PROJECT FROM MARCH 1, 2023 - FEBRUARY 29, 2024. THE NORTH PACIFIC FISHERIES MANAGEMENT COUNCIL (COUNCIL) HAS BEEN REEVALUATING PROTECTIVE MEASURES FOR BRISTOL BAY RED KING CRAB; HOWEVER, BECAUSE RED KING CRAB DISTRIBUTIONS ARE ONLY WELL DOCUMENTED IN THE SUMMER, IT HAS BEEN DIFFICULT FOR THE COUNCIL TO DETERMINE WHETHER CURRENT CLOSURE AREAS ARE ADEQUATE OR IF ADDITIONAL CLOSURE AREAS ARE NEEDED TO IMPROVE THE LIKELIHOOD OF POPULATION RECOVERY THROUGH THE REDUCTION OF BYCATCH IN GROUNDFISH FISHERIES. THIS IS HIGH PRIORITY RESEARCH FOR BERING SEA CRAB, GIVEN THE CONSERVATION AND SOCIOECONOMIC URGENCY, WITH A FOCUS ON IMPROVING STOCK RECOVERY THROUGH RESEARCH ON UPDATED SEASONAL DISTRIBUTION AND REDUCING FISHING IMPACTS. THIS PROJECT WOULD BE CONDUCTED BY TAGGING AND SURVEYING RED KING CRAB TO UNDERSTAND MOVEMENTS AND RELATIVE POPULATION DISTRIBUTION IN BRISTOL BAY. THIS PROJECT

THE GOAL OF THIS PROGRAM IS TO MANAGE, ENHANCE, RESTORE AND MAINTAIN THE SHARED FISHERIES, PROTECTED SPECIES AND FISHERIES HABITAT OF THE PACIFIC COAST.  THIS GRANT WILL SUPPORT THE CONSERVATION AND RESTORATION OF MARINE FISHERY RESOURCES AND THEIR HABITAT, AS WELL AS THE MAINTENANCE, ENHANCEMENT, AND IMPROVEMENT OF PUBLIC USES AND BENEFITS FROM THESE RESOURCES, INCLUDING SEAFOOD PRODUCTION, RECREATION, AND COMMERCE.

PURPOSE: THIS PROJECT WILL SUPPORT THE MODERNIZATION OF THE LOCAL FISHERY DATA COLLECTION SYSTEMS FOR THE FISHERIES OF THE WESTERN PACIFIC, INCLUDING AMERICAN SAMOA, GUAM, THE COMMONWEALTH OF THE NORTHERN MARIANA ISLANDS, AND THE STATE OF HAWAII.  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:  MODERNIZATION OF THE WESTERN PACIFIC FISHERIES INFORMATION NETWORK DATABASE SO MULTIPLE DISPARATE DATASETS COLLECTED BY THE PACIFIC ISLAND STATES AND TERRITORIES CAN BE WAREHOUSED FOR IMPROVED ACCESS AND REGIONAL COORDINATION. CREATION OF TERRITORIAL REQUESTED DATA MODULES FOR THE CATCHIT LOGIT APPLICATION AND INTEGRATING THESE DATA STREAMS INTO THE DATABASE.  ASSISTANCE WITH ACCESSING AND ANALYZING DATA DURING THE MODERNIZATION PROCESS WILL ALSO BE PROVIDED TO MEET THE PACIFIC ISLAND STATES AND TERRITORIES' NEEDS.  ASSESSING AND POTENTIALLY REDESIGNING THE CURRENT FISHING CREEL SURVEY METHODS USED IN THE TERRITORIES TO SUPPORT MODERN STOCK ASSESSMENT METHODS AND TO PRODUCE THE BEST ESTIMATES OF CATCH AND EFFORT

THE OVERARCHING GOAL OF THIS FEDERALLY FUNDED PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDS TO THE PACIFIC STATES MARINE FISHERIES COMMISSION TO 1). PROVIDE DATA SUPPORT AND ENSURE ALL DATA IS ACCESSIBLE TO FISHERIES MANAGERS, THE NORTH PACIFIC FISHERY MANAGEMENT COUNCIL AND ITS PLAN DEVELOPMENT TEAMS AND SCIENTIFIC AND STATISTICAL COMMITTEE AND EACH PARTICIPATING AGENCY TO MEET RESPECTIVE FISHERIES MANAGEMENT RESPONSIBILITIES, 2). COLLECT, RECORD, ANALYZE, INTERPRET, STORE AND MAKE AVAILABLE THE FISHERY CATCH INFORMATION FROM ALASKA'S MARINE FISHERIES AND CONTINUE DEVELOPMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF A COMPUTER DATABASE SYSTEM DESIGNED TO EFFICIENTLY STORE AND RETRIEVE CATCH AND PRODUCTION DATA ON AN AREA WIDE NETWORK.

PACIFIC STATES MARINE FISHERIES COMMISSION INVOLVES SCIENTISTS, THE FISHING INDUSTRY, COMMERCIAL FISHERS, RESEARCHERS, AND OTHER COOPERATORS IN COLLABORATIVE RESEARCH TO INCREASE AND IMPROVE THE INFORMATION BASE FOR WEST COAST FISHERIES DATA COLLECTION.  PROPOSED COOPERATIVE RESEARCH ACTIVITIES MAY INCLUDE DATA COLLECTION, COLLABORATION WITH FISHING INDUSTRY IN DEVELOPING DATA COLLECTION PLANS, MEETINGS AND WORKSHOPS, OUTREACH AND OTHER COLLABORATIVE ACTIVITIES TO CONDUCT STUDIES OFF THE WEST COAST AND ASSESS AND COLLECT DATA FOR WEST COAST FISHERIES.

ALASKA DEPARTMENT OF FISH AND GAME PLANS TO DEVELOP AN ESTIMATE OF THE SUBSISTENCE HARVEST OF HALIBUT IN ALASKA FOR THE CALENDAR YEAR 2022, PRIMARILY THROUGH A MAILED SURVEY AND SUPPLEMENTED BY A LIMITED NUMBER OF FACE-TO-FACE INTERVIEWS IN SELECT COMMUNITIES. THE PROJECT WILL BE IMPLEMENTED BY THE ALASKA DEPARTMENT OF FISH & GAME IN COLLABORATION WITH THE NATIONAL MARINE FISHERIES SERVICE (NMFS) AND ALASKA NATIVE TRIBES.

PURPOSE: THIS PROJECT COLLECTS RECREATIONAL FISHING INFORMATION THROUGH IN-PERSON INTERVIEWS WITH BOTH SHORE AND BOAT FISHERS AT POPULAR FISHING SITES THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF HAWAII.    ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: FOR EACH TWO-MONTH SURVEY PERIOD, TRAINED SURVEYORS VISIT PUBLIC BOAT RAMPS, BEACHES, PIERS, AND OTHER PUBLICLY ACCESSIBLE FISHING SITES TO COUNT AND INTERVIEW FISHERS AS PART OF THE ACCESS POINT ANGLER INTERCEPT SURVEY. ELIGIBLE FISHERS INCLUDE THOSE USING A ROD-AND-REEL, SPEAR, NET, OR OTHER METHOD OF HARVEST. THE SURVEY IS USED TO ESTIMATE CATCH RATE OR THE NUMBER OF FISH CAUGHT ON EACH FISHING TRIP. DURING AN INTERVIEW, SURVEYORS IDENTIFY, MEASURE, AND WEIGH THE FISH THAT WERE CAUGHT, AND COLLECT INFORMATION ABOUT THE FISH THAT WERE RELEASED. SAMPLING SITES ARE RANDOMLY SELECTED BUT WEIGHTED ACCORDING TO CURRENT FISHING PRESSURES TO ENSURE THAT MORE ACTIVE SITES ARE SAMPLED MORE OFTEN.  EXPECTED OUTCOMES: A RELIABLE DATABASE FOR ESTIMATING THE IMPACT OF RECREATIONAL F

THE PACIFIC FISHERIES INFORMATION NETWORK (PACFIN) IS A COLLABORATION BETWEEN MEMBER STATE AND FEDERAL FISHERY AGENCIES THAT SUPPLY THE INFORMATION NEEDED TO EFFECTIVELY MANAGE FISH STOCKS ON THE WEST COAST OF THE UNITED STATES. THE DATA ARE STORED, PROCESSED AND DISSEMINATED BY MEMBERS OF THE PACFIN STAFF.

THIS PROJECTS ACTIVITIES WILL BE PERFORMED BY THE ALASKA DEPARTMENT OF FISH AND GAME WITH PARTIAL FUNDING PROVIDED BY AN AWARD OF $764,702 ("BERING SEA CRAB RESEARCH XXI") TO SUPPORT RESEARCH, GATHER DATA, AND DISTRIBUTE DATA ON THE COMMERCIAL CRAB FISHERY STOCKS OF THE BERING SEA AND ALEUTIAN ISLANDS (BSAI). THOSE ACTIVITIES ARE DIRECTED TOWARDS PROVIDING INFORMATION TO FISHERY MANAGERS, THE ALASKA BOARD OF FISHERIES, AND THE NORTH PACIFIC FISHERY MANAGEMENT COUNCIL THAT IS NEEDED TO MANAGE CRAB FISHERIES CONSISTENT WITH STATE OF ALASKA COMMERCIAL FISHERY REGULATIONS, THE POLICY ON KING AND TANNER CRAB RESOURCE MANAGEMENT GOAL AND BENEFITS, THE FISHERY MANAGEMENT PLAN FOR THE COMMERCIAL KING AND TANNER CRAB FISHERIES IN THE BERING SEA/ALEUTIAN ISLANDS, AND NATIONAL STANDARDS 1 AND 2 OF THE MAGNUSON-STEVENS FISHERY CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT ACT. THE WESTWARD REGION BERING SEA ALEUTIAN ISLAND CRAB RESEARCH WILL BE PERFORMED BY FISH AND GAME STAFF IN THE KODIAK AND DU

TO ASSIST IN THE NATION'S EXPANDING NEEDS FOR DATA COLLECTION THROUGH THE CONTINUATION OF THE VESSEL MONITORING SYSTEM (VMS) TO ACHIEVE THE OPTIMAL SUSTAINABLE VALUE TO SOCIETY AND FUTURE GENERATIONS FROM THE NATION'S MARINE ECOSYSTEMS AND TO ASSIST IN THE EXPANSION OF VMS DATA COLLECTION THROUGH NEW VMS IMPLEMENTATIONS IN FEDERAL FISHERIES. THIS PROGRAM SEEKS TO BUILD ON PACIFIC STATES MARINE FISHERIES COMMISSION'S PIONEERING WORK AS A FACILITATOR OF VMS DATA COLLECTION. PUBLIC BENEFITS INCLUDE SUSTAINING THE NATION'S FISHING CAPACITY AND ADVANCING THE CONSERVATION AND UTILIZATION OF THE PUBLIC'S LIVING MARINE RESOURCES AND PROVIDING RELIEF DIRECTLY TO FISHERMEN FOR THEIR COST BURDENS ASSOCIATED WITH PURCHASING AN ENHANCED MOBILE TRANSCEIVER UNIT. THE PSMFC WILL BE INSTRUMENTAL IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF THIS ONGOING PROGRAM TO ACQUIRE DATA THAT WILL BE TRANSMITTED THROUGH THE VMS UNITS AND USED TO FOSTER BETTER MANAGEMENT AND CONSERVATION EFFORTS.
